page.title: 13ECOLOGY IN STURTON
page.content:
THE AREA IS{GRADE 3 AGRICULTURAL {LAND,}WITH HEAVY{ALKALINE CLAY.}THE ARABLE FIELDS ARE GRADUALLY BECOMING LARGER BY THE REMOVAL OF HEDGES,MAKING ACCESS TO FOOTPATHS MORE DIFFICULT.
{INTENSIVE FARMING,}WHICH USES MORE CHEMICAL SPRAYS AND FERTILIZERS,HAS CAUSED A{LOSS OF FLORA AND FAUNA}WHICH ARE NOW RESTRICTED TO ROADSIDE VERGES. COMMON PLANTS ARE{COW PARSLEY}AND {DANDELIONS}WITH SOME{COWSLIPS}AND {VIOLETS.}THE AREA IS LACKING IN CONSERVATION. POLLUTION OCCURS ONLY OCCASIONALLY AND IS RESTRICTED TO WATER COURSES. AS THIS IS AN EASTERN COUNTY AND THE PREVAILING WIND IS FROM THE SOUTH WEST THE{CLIMATE}IS FAIRLY{DRY AND WINDY. THE AVERAGE{RAINFALL}IS 23 INCHES PER ANNUM.{SNOWFALL}IS USUALLY QUITE {LIGHT. }
